Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CathyBrace
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Clean, new. If you are from the US talk to the morning receptionists they were helpful and smiled. Forget the night guys. They really had ATTITUDE!!

Reviews.Title: “Adagio Paris XV”
Reviews.Author: Keithbz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it is an II exchange hotel. Otherwise we would never have found it, let alone chosen it. If you are visiting "the sights" of Paris it is a long way. In fact it's not even in Paris, being the wrong side of the Peripherique. But it's a short walk to the metro and there is a T2 tram outside if you want to go to La Defense. I read some older reviews before we traveled and I can confirm that the stains on the carpets are still there after 3 years. There is no service in the rooms whatsover. You will have to change your bedding and vacuum the floor yourself. The leg of one (small single) bed was broken when we arrived but I fixed it myself. However, the people at the front desk were friendly and helpful. There is a nice restaurant in Corentin nearby "Bistro du Boucher". You need to book.

Reviews.Title: “Good for kids”
Reviews.Author: CharlesPatrickM Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good for kids and to have a small kitchen but rooms were hot. If not aircon then fans would be good. We liked the local village and shops and it was quite close to the metro. Good value for money (no maid service).

Reviews.Title: “Grand spot”
Reviews.Author: williejoeIreland
Reviews.Content: Not much to worry about here. Apartment was fine. Toilet was a bit small. The only thing that went against us was their electronic key cards. Every evening when we came back from our day of sightseeing we found that we were locked out. Overall, very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for longer stays or if looking for something different”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel towards the end of a long trip to France for business. It was ideally placed for anyone working in La Defense (just a Tram T2 ride away) but who needs a longer term stay or wants to get away from the big name hotels in the business district. It would also be very useful if you are attending an exhibition at the Porte de Versailles centre. The room was excellent, large, well though out and the kitchen was well equipped with fridge and microwave as well as stove top. Plenty of utensils were available. The hotel was quiet and well run. Internet was free and worked well, and the television had plenty of channels. The bathroom was clean and the shower worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Kanthony1
Reviews.Content: Frankly, I was worried that I was going to need to switch hotels due to past reviews. I think it's only fair to update those negative reviews. Adagio Paris took over this faculty back in 2008 and the renovations were awesome. My condo was modern, and well-decorated. However, the shower could use a vent and it's a steep step to get out. If you use the metro to get around, it can be a little trek. The light rail is steps from the hotel door. Maybe I could have taken advantage of that better. I found that taxi drivers will drive you all over the city unless you appear to know where you're going. The morning breakfast was worth the 10 euros. The staff could have been a little bit more alert of the neighborhood. They sent me to restaurants that were closed. An overall pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be afraid, it is Better than reported!”
Reviews.Author: MKC_PRC
Reviews.Content: May be after renovation, the room is fine to us, a family of 4. Good environment as we facing the interior garden. Fresh air coming from window. Small kitchen but good for us. However, only coin-operated washing machine at basement and you need to change lift at ground floor. WC a little bit smaller and ventilation fans could be added. Sofa bed could be turned into two single beds easily and good for sleeping. Metro and supermarket nearby, with trams outside as well going outside Paris - good to Palace of Versailles (by tram+bus) as better sight and CHEAPER than by tube!! Downside is service when i was only told the PIN for the main entrance after the 3rd day i stayed ! We take taxi instead of the transfer suggested, particularly to Orly, which is much much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Please close your hotel and renovate it rapidly”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 6, 4 adults with 2 kids of 8 and 6. Reception services were poor. As we arrived early and hotel was full, our lugages were kept in the lugage room without any surveillance from the hotel staff. We were told that it's normal and there wasn't any report of lost??? Strange that everybody can access to the room and take whatever they like... Ref to the room: interior is badly decorated and not functionning well. It's time that the hotel management get aware that the hotel is substandard. I highly don't recommend this hotel to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Utilitarian”
Reviews.Author: Geologist_from_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of our daughter’s Paris tour. The rooms were utilitarian, with an “Ikea” flavor. Open window’s sufficed as “air conditioning.” The front desk service was good, and the included breakfast was adequate for our family’s needs and tastes. The Metro was a manageable stroll away, and the surrounding neighborhood felt safe. Cons: the internet/wifi was not working, and the clothes dryer in the basement did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Shut it down”
Reviews.Author: cookingjim
Reviews.Content: Although the staff was cordial and efficient. The building and rooms are horrible. The top four floors are closed for renovation so on top of noise and filthy old rooms, I was so disappointed. Cracked walls, beat up furniture, cigarette burns in rugs, dirty carpeting are just a few of dozens of issues. The building needs to be closed until renovation is done. Walls are thin you hear many things. You can hear plumbing a couple of flights up. Never to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Large room for family, not an easy location for the Paris sights”
Reviews.Author: Cottagergirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this based on the room size and kitchenette availability. The staff at check in were efficient and sent up a baby cot and high chair right away. The room was large and could be divided into separate quarters, which is nice when traveling with kids (we had a baby and a 4 year old). The room was a bit shabby and the WC had a bad odour. The location was not good for us. We had a stroller so the Metro wasn't an option. We had to take cabs to/from the city centre sights (Eiffel Tower, Seine, etc.) and that cost about 16euros each way. There was a small grocery store around the corner, and a school playground too.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favourite”
Reviews.Author: Zsenia
Reviews.Content: I went in a longer business trip to Paris together with some colleagues and the hotel was arranged from Paris side. The hotel looked good from outside, but then the rooms were disappointing. The room/apart I stayed in was large, yet old and not very clean. The furniture looked rather old and the doors were scratched (the front door was probably hit and had a hole which I reported to reception, but nobody fixed this during my stay, although they said so:-) ). The mini kitchen is very helpful, but I think nobody cleans all the kitchenware, the fridge wasn't working, it was dirty and full of water inside - the smell was terrible! They fixed that after I report it, yet they haven't cleaned inside the fridge. If you stay a longer period, be aware that they clean rooms once every 7 days! Other wise, the reception staff was very helpful, able to speak other languages (English, Spanish etc) and the free wifi offers a good Internet connection. The reason I won't recommend this hotel is that in a colleague found in the room bugs in bed during night . This was reported and eventually we changed hotel. If you see mattresses being disposed in front of the hotel, this is the reason.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable flat with kitchenette”
Reviews.Author: alanreynolds
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on Tuesday 3 November 2009 in order to attend a meeting in the building the next day. This property is one of two in the Adagio chain in the area and is well situated near the Porte de Versailles exhibition centre. A tramway extension is being completed outside will improve public transport access. I arrived at 23.00 to find my reservation in good order. The flat had a large bed with duvet and two other settees which could be converted into beds. So it could sleep 4 in fair privacy. There is a kitchenette with microwave, hot plate, coffee machine and fridge. I did not use these. The furniture looked a bit tired. The bathroom looked recently modernised compared with rest of the flat, though the bath tap was not properly fixed and wobbled about when touched! The toilet was in a separate room. There is breakfast served downstairs. The price for one night without breakfast was EUR 120, though I noted the tariff showed lower prices for longer stays

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: florida3122
Reviews.Content: I went on a tour with efcollegebreak and they booked this place for us. The people that had been to Paris before were raving about how nice the place was compared to the other places they had stayed in Paris. I had not been before and found the place gross. The staff spoke English which was a big help for me and they were overly friendly. There were 4 of us to a room so we needed extra bedding and they brought it right up to us. The rooms were nice and big, just need to be updated. No A/C which is common in Europe. It had a mini kitchen a living with two couches to sleep on and a bedroom. It is not that close to the main attractions so you must take the metro to get to them. It is not that difficult to get around on and it is not that far from the hotel. There are a lot of restaraunts around it so that is a plus. The breakfast is not bad, just your regular European continental breakfast of yogurt, lunch meat, cheese, juice/coffee and bread. Feel free to contact me!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad price but a lttle shabby”
Reviews.Author: stokegifford
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in a four bed apartment with my wife and two adult daughters whilst there for the rugby world cup. The room was shabby and tired looking and when I attempted to close the sliding door seperating the two sleeping areas it came off the runners and would not close.It stayed that way. The rates of just under £100 per night for four people in a fairly centrally located hotel is quite reasonable but at the end of the day you get what you pay for. One word of warning about the breakfast. When booking in, the receptionist told us that is was a hot buffet that would "set us up for the day". There was no language confusion here as my eldest speaks good french. The reality was that the "hot buffet breakfast" was coffee, croissants fruit juice and stale looking ham. At over £6 per person per day I thought that this was excessive and asked for a refund which was eventually given. For a little more money there are a number of cafes nearby serving decent food. Overall not bad value for Paris but beware of the hot buffet breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Urgent need of repairing”
Reviews.Author: Alexey1
Reviews.Content: I have planned to stay in this hotel because the organizers of the exhibition reserved it tome as a 3 star hotel. Actually I have left after trying of the several rooms. The problem was that it was late at night and it was quite difficult to find room in the other hotel in the place. Actually the problem is that the property is in quite bad state at least cosmetically. I have met with the holes in the curtains broken furniture and etc. First rooms were not cleaned up well. Actually the bed was clean but the floor and the surfaces not. Finally I have proposed quite clean room without holes in curtains and quite clean floor. But when I evidently opened the refrigerator it was quite clean inside but smells as an old fish man. And in the bathroom I found something looks like very close to louses so it became impossible for me to stay in the room and I decided to leave the hotel. By the way I evidently by mistake firstly com to the nearby hotel of Pierre et Vacances near by of the same class and it was looks like OK on the first glance. And the staff in the hotel was quite friendly. But the things which were good in the 70-s need some repair since that time.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: miztikk
Reviews.Content: This was a disgusting hotel. The staff was extremely rude and stole some electronics from the room, there appeared to be water damage to the ceiling, and we didn't have hot water for three days. I hated this "hotel", and will never, ever book on my own ever again. I was staying with a summer program and thought for the money we deserved 100x more. DO NOT STAY! (It is actually ATTACHED to the Pierre & Vacances Porte De Versailles hotel, so it's not even actually in Paris. )

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Enila
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very clean, close to everything ... no need to take the car to visit all Paris. The pool and fitness were not yet available. The room was very spacious and modernly decorated. The bed and the sofa bed were very comfortable. There were no cleaning materials unfortunately as one usually finds in apathotels. Did not try breakfast (too expensive) but there is a bakery and a minimarket close-by. We definitely would stay again in this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Adagio Paris XV
HotelInfo.Address: 20 Rue d'Oradour sur Glane, 75015 Paris, France
